HTTPHeadersSet-Cookie.summary:
The Set-Cookie HTTP response header is used to send a cookie from the server to the user agent, so that the user agent can send it back to the server later.
To send multiple cookies, multiple Set-Cookie headers should be sent in the same response.

blockquote.para: Warning: Browsers block frontend JavaScript code from accessing the Set-Cookie header, as required by the Fetch spec, which defines Set-Cookie as a forbidden response-header name that must be filtered out from any response exposed to frontend code.

remarks.para: For more information, see the guide on Using HTTP cookies.
